lines.content: - Used ChatGPT for refactoring a hefty/clunky function, overall improving code quality

- I did this by giving ChatGPT some context into the core application that I'm building, and then pointing it to my specific function that I want to refactor. I also mentioned some core concepts learned in CS2103T such as maintaining the same level of abstraction throughout the same function.
- Used GitHub Copilot for automatic code completions, as well as generating JavaDoc comments

YormBot frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It's,
All you need to do is,
4. let it manage your tasks for you 😉
If you are a Java programmer, you can use it to practice Java too. Here's the `main` method:
Use YormBot to keep track of your todos!
Use YormBot to keep track of your deadlines!
Use YormBot to keep track of your afters!
Use YormBot to keep track of your event!
Use YormBot to list your existing tasks!
Use YormBot to find your tasks!
Use YormBot to delete your tasks!
Once you're done with YormBot, feel free to exit!

Command command = assertDoesNotThrow(() -> Parser.parse("todo read book"));
Command command = assertDoesNotThrow(() -> Parser.parse("deadline return book /by 2026-06-06"));
assertEquals(new AddCommand(new Deadline("return book", LocalDate.of(2026, 6, 6))), command);
assertEquals(new AddCommand(new After("return book", LocalDate.of(2026, 8, 6))), command);
assertThrows(YormException.class, () -> Parser.parse("mark not a number"), "Error in mark instruction");
assertThrows(YormException.class, () -> Parser.parse("unmark not a number"), "Error in unmark instruction");
assertThrows(YormException.class, () -> Parser.parse("delete not a number"), "Error in delete instruction");
assertThrows(YormException.class, () -> Parser.parse("deadline hello"), "Error in deadline instruction");
Parser.parse("deadline hello /by invalidDate"), "Error in deadline instruction");
assertThrows(YormException.class, () -> Parser.parse("event hello"), "Error in event instruction");
Parser.parse("event hello /from invalidDate /to 2026-08-07"), "Error in deadline instruction");
assertThrows(YormException.class, () -> Parser.parse("after hello"), "Error in after instruction");
Parser.parse("after hello /after invalidDate"), "Error in after instruction");
After after = new After("return book", LocalDate.of(2026, 6, 6));
Deadline deadline = new Deadline("return book", LocalDate.of(2026, 6, 6));
Event event = new Event("project meeting", LocalDate.of(2026, 8, 6), LocalDate.of(2026, 8, 7));
assertEquals("[E][ ] project meeting (from: Aug 6 2026 to: Aug 7 2026)", event.toString());
assertEquals("[E][X] project meeting (from: Aug 6 2026 to: Aug 7 2026)", event.toString());
